parsed.sn: Rance's Choosing and the Destruction of Lisle

recap.outcomes: Lisle village completely obliterated - nothing but ash and charred foundations remain. Rance's unknown Mage-Gift awakened violently during attack, destroying village and some attackers (he doesn't know he caused it). Senta Chose Rance at the ruins after three years unpartnered. The Choosing bond is stabilizing his wild Gift channels enough to survive.
recap.threads: Attackers systematically abducted villagers - organized operation, not random raid. Evidence points to red-robed group disguised as bandits, trail leads toward Menmellith border. Something/someone watching from treeline - attackers may return. Rance has evidence (blade wrapped in red hood) but needs to reach Haven with testimony.
recap.state: Rance in severe Gift-shock, magical channels 'burned-wide' causing white-hot agony. Currently heading to waystation three miles from Lisle for herbs before continuing to Haven without rest. Carrying attacker's blade with red hood wrapped around it as evidence.

entities.name: Rance
content: 40-year-old former headman of Lisle with military background (skilled rider, methodical evidence examination)
Mage-Gift awakened violently during Lisle attack - has been suppressing it unknowingly his entire life. Trauma of watching villagers abducted triggered wild magical fury
Gift aftermath: Magical channels 'burned-wide' causing white-hot agony. Can now sense magical currents and mental channels but has no frame of reference to understand or control them
Believes external force destroyed Lisle - has no idea his own awakened Gift caused the devastation
Catalogs losses of villagers, homes, lives. Carries weight of leadership and failure. Beneath guilt and grief lies steel core of determination
Self-described as 'one bitter old man' but remains focused on mission: get evidence and testimony to Haven

entities.name: Senta
content: Brilliant white Companion mare with sapphire eyes and silver-white mane
Was unpartnered for THREE YEARS after achieving adult status, searching for her Chosen
Rance: Chose him at Lisle ruins. The bond is stabilizing his wild Gift, forming 'bridges across the burning chasms in his mind' - not healed but survivable

Rance: To Rance at Choosing: 'Chosen. My name is Senta. I Choose you. You are never alone again. You did this, Rance. The power came from within you. A Gift awakened by trauma and fear. I don't know which, but it is immensely powerful.'
Rance: Insisted on stopping at waystation for herbs to treat Gift-shock before his mind fractures beyond repair
Assessment of attackers: Red robes under bandit garb suggests organized cult or sect. Systematic abduction pattern indicates purpose beyond raiding

entities.name: Lisle
content: Small village on Valdemar's outskirts, near borders with Karse, Rethwellan, and Menmellith
Now completely obliterated - nothing remains but ash, charred timber fragments, and scorched stone foundations
Destroyed by Rance's awakening Mage-Gift during attack, though he doesn't know he caused it
Rance was the headman and led militia defense before destruction

entities.name: Red Robe Evidence
content: Attacker's blade with red hood cut from robe and wrapped around it
Found on attacker body at blast edge - wore obvious bandit outer clothing but had RED ROBE hidden underneath
Rance is carrying this as evidence to Haven
Footprints from attack site lead toward Menmellith border

entities.name: Lisle Attackers
content: Systematically incapacitated and carried off Lisle villagers - abduction operation, not killing raid
Wore obvious bandit outer clothing but had red robes hidden underneath
Trail leads toward Menmellith border, but Rance assesses: 'Menmellith. Or at least, what they wanted it to appear as.'
Organized cult or sect (per Senta's analysis) - systematic abduction pattern indicates purpose beyond ordinary raiding
May still be watching from treeline near ruins

entities.name: Gift Awakening Through Trauma
content: Mage-Gifts can be unknowingly suppressed for entire lifetimes, then violently awakened by extreme trauma
Traumatic awakening can cause wild, uncontrolled magical fury that burns open mental channels
Gift-shock aftermath: Magical channels 'burned-wide' causing severe pain. Victim can sense magical currents and mental channels but has no frame of reference to understand or control them
Without treatment, Gift-shock can cause mind to fracture beyond repair
Companion Choosing bond can stabilize wild Gift channels, forming 'bridges across the burning chasms' - not healed but survivable
